bind.calculate: if(/data/prev_alert_flag = 'yes' or selected(/data/emergency_signs/emergency_signs/emergency_signs_list, 'difficulty_breathing') or selected(/data/emergency_signs/emergency_signs/emergency_signs_list, 'shock') or selected(/data/emergency_signs/emergency_signs/emergency_signs_list, 'vaginal_bleeding') or selected(/data/emergency_signs/emergency_signs/emergency_signs_list, 'convulsions_unconsciousness') or selected(/data/emergency_signs/emergency_signs/emergency_signs_list, 'prolapsed_cord') or selected(/data/emergency_signs/emergency_signs/emergency_signs_list, 'fetal_distress') or (/data/exam_indicators/bp/systolic >= 140 and /data/exam_indicators/bp/diastolic >= 90) or /data/exam_indicators/fhs/fhs < 110 or /data/exam_indicators/fhs/fhs > 160 or /data/exam_indicators/af/af = "Meconium" or /data/exam_indicators/af/af = "Blood", 'yes', 'no')

text.value: If fundal grip was "any other" please explain here:
Choose the measurements you would like to record:
Last measured cervical dilation: Time recorded: :
What is the current cervical dilation (cms)?
Dilation is less than 4cm. Patient is in LATENT labour.
Last measured station of the fetal head: Time recorded: :
What is the station of the head?
Last measured fetal heart rate: Time recorded: :
What is the current fetal heart rate?
Warning! A fetal heart rate of more than 160 or less than 110 indicates fetal distress.
Suggested Action: Increase monitoring frequency to every 15 minutes.
Last recorded amniotic fluid color: Time recorded: :
What is the color of the amniotic fluid?
Warning! Meconium or Blood Stained amniotic fluid indicates severe fetal distress.
Suggested Action: Call a doctor. Prepare for cesarean section.
What is the current moulding of fetal skull bones?
Last measured number of contractions: Last measured duration of contractions: Time recorded: :
What is the current number of contractions per 10 minutes?
What is the current duration of a contraction? (in seconds)
Last measured blood pressure: Time recorded: :
Warning! A BP of 140/90 may indicate pre-eclampsia.
Temperature is recorded in degrees Celsius
Last measured respiration count: Time recorded: :
What is the current number of respirations per minute?
Last measured urine output: Time recorded: :
Has the woman passed urine since last measurement?
Did the urine contain any of the following?
Has oxytocin been administered during the current exam?
How many drops per minute were administered?
Previous drugs and IV fluids given: Time recorded: :
Have other drugs or IV fluids been administered during the current exam?
What are the drugs or IV fluids being administered (amount and frequency)?
Identify if the patient has any of the following emergency signs:
Please unselect "None of the above" if recording emergency sign.
Call the Doctor, start the drip, start the oxygen and raise foot end
Call the doctor and start the drip
Make sure there is no tongue bite and gag reflex
Wrap the cord and put it back in the Vagina
Get the patient ready for delivery (if fully dilated) and check FHS
Suggested Action: Call an expert for help or refer patient.
What would you like to do?
Flag this patient for increased monitoring. Continue exam.
Would you like to Remove the already existing flag?
When would you like to receive an exam reminder for this patient?
Would you like to set a 4 hour reminder to do a PV exam?
